revised_title: The Function and Structure of Tsetse Larva's Respiratory Lobes
tldr: The author studied the structure and function of the respiratory lobes in tsetse larva. They discovered a unique respiratory system involving a series of valves, air chambers, and a felt chamber that acts as a "perforated piston." This system allows the tsetse larva to breathe and move air through its tracheal system efficiently. The author also found that the respiratory muscles play a crucial role in this process.
